alert.note: Alert for Franklin (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 25 at 1:36PM MDT by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM MDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Franklin County in southeast Idaho. * WHEN...Until 300 PM MDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Streams and creeks running high. Water over a few back roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 119 PM MDT, Local law enforcement and emergency management personnel reported that minor flooding due to snowmelt continues across the advisory area. Many fields have standing water, creeks and streams are running high, and a few back roads are affected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Preston, Franklin, Oneida Narrows Reservoir, Thatcher, Dayton, Weston, Clifton, Oxford, Riverdale, Mink Creek, Whitney, Mapleton and Emmigrant Summit. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
